Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_set_filter_sample_preference

The function AIL_set_filter_sample_preference sets the value of the specified sample-level preference.

void AIL_set_filter_sample_preference(
  HSAMPLE S,
  char const * name,
  void const * value
);

In Parameters

S
specifies the filter to set.
name
specifies the name of the preference to set.
value
specifies an address of the 32-bit value that will be set. The type of the data that this parameter points to should match the "type" field in the RIB_INTERFACE_ENTRY structure returned from AIL_enumerate_filter_attributes.

Discussion

Sample-level preferences are preferences that are set for a single sample. For preferences that are global to the filter, use the AIL_set_filter_preference function.

This function sets the value of a preference. To retrieve the current setting, use the AIL_filter_sample_attribute function.

Example files that use this function: Filter.CPP

Related FAQs: How do I set a DSP filter on a sample?
